It was clear that the quest to further characterize ‘wild’ microbial assemblages was worth pursuing since there was still so much left to learn.

We also found that many piezophilic isolates biosynthesized large amounts of polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) and incorporated them into their membrane lipids, yet another adaptation to deep-sea lowtemperature and high-pressure (DeLong and Yayanos, 1986).
